topic.title: Create Users and Assign Roles
topic.shortdesc: To continue preparations for application access-testing, create users and assign different roles to them.

section.title: User-Creation Process
section.p: The process of user-creation and role-assignment was described in the section Creating and Managing Users. You will now use this process to create three users, each of whom has a different combination of roles.

Note that passwords suggested in this example assume that the default Couchbase Server password-policy is enforced: which is that the password must have a minimum of 6 characters. If a stronger policy has been enforced, stronger passwords are required.

section.title: Create a Reader
section.p: Left-click on the Security tab, to bring up the Security view; and ensure that the Users tab (along the top, horizontal bar) is selected. Then, left-click on the Add User button, at the upper right. When the Add New User dialog appears, specify a Username of composersReader, and an identical Password. The dialog now appears as follows:

Then, access the Roles pane, and scroll down until you reach the Data Roles element. Open Data Roles, and then open Data Reader. Check the Data Reader checkbox for the composers bucket. The dialog now appears as follows:
Now left-click on the Save button. The Security view now appears as follows:

section.title: Create a Writer
section.p: Within the Security view, again left-click on the Add User button. When the Manage User dialog appears, specify a Username of composersWriter, and an identical Password. Then, access the Roles panel, and scroll down. Open the Data Roles and Data Reader Writer items, and check the Data Reader Writer checkbox for the composers bucket. Then, left-click on the Save button. This saves your second user-definition, and returns you again to the Security view.

section.title: Create an Index Writer
section.p: It should be noted that Couchbase RBAC defines index-creation as a special privilege; distinct from the privileges of writing either document-content or otherwise administrative, bucket-related data. Therefore, for index-creation, a specific role must be assigned the user.

Within the Security view, again left-click on the Add User button. When the Manage User dialog appears, specify a Username of composersIndexMaker, and an identical Password. Then, access the Roles panel, and scroll down. Open the Query Roles and Query Manage Index levels of the roles hierarchy, and check the Query Manage Index checkbox for the composers bucket. Then, left-click on the Save button. This saves your second user-definition, and returns you again to the Security view; which now appears as follows:

section.title: Next
section.p: This concludes your creation of users. You can now use the Couchbase cbq tool to test the access each has to the composers buckets, in accordance with the roles you have assigned them. Proceed to the next section, Perform cbq Access Tests.
